results.title: Welcome to Ion!
results.content:
Welcome to the next generation of the TJ Intranet system. Thanks for helping us test the new system before its official release in Fall 2015. Please note that you still need to sign up for eighth period on http://iodine.tjhsst.edu for the remainder of this year.

Here are a few quick tips to get you started:

On desktop browsers, navigation buttons are displayed on the left side of the page. On mobile browsers, you must press the hamburger icon in the upper left. This will also reveal the search bar.

To view your user profile, hit the user icon next to your name in the upper right corner. This is also where you can log out and submit feedback.

To sign up for eighth period, either choose a block on the homescreen widget or hit the "Eighth" button in the navigation. For teachers, you may take attendance for activities in the same manner.

If you have any questions or comments, please use the "Send Feedback" functionality or contact the Intranet Developers directly at intranet@tjhsst.edu. We're looking forward to hearing your feedback!

If you want to help us test Ion in a more official capacity, sign up for the beta program here.

-- Ethan Lowman and James Woglom
results.author: Intranet Developers

results.title: Lunchtime Info Session on UPenn and Columbia, Thursday in the CCC
results.content: Juniors interested in the University of Pennsylvania and Columbia University are invited to attend a lunch info session on Thursday during lunch in the CCC. Our speaker is Ms. Kochman, who teaches English here at TJ. She will share her experience studying at both universities -- what was good, what was a challenge -- and answer your questions. Bring your lunch, chocolate chip cookies provided!

results.title: Sports Pep Rally + Volleyball Finals TODAY!
results.content:
Hey TJ! Don't forget to sign up for the SPECIAL: Sports Pep Rally today, Wednesday, March 17th, during B Block to watch the two remaining teams from the February Frenzy Volleyball tournament play head-to-head in tournament Finals!

Afterwards, both Winter and Spring athletes will be recognized for their achievements, giving YOU the opportunity to snag some tjColonials Sunglasses!

The rally will end with the tournament champions playing the Ultimate Staff Volleyball team led by Mr. Campbell! See you there!
results.author: James Woglom

results.title: TJ's Annual Service Week: March 14 to March 20th
results.content: Service Week, March 14th to March 20th, is a time for TJ to reflect on our role in the the community. This year, our theme is "We Are The World" to remind us that even if our efforts are not on a global level, they have a global impact. We strongly encourage you to participate in a Service Week drive, check out a service club 8th period, and discover new service opportunities through the flyers and brochures listed on our new SGA website: http://tinyurl.com/tjserviceweek.

results.title: American Invitational Mathematics Examination
results.content:
AIME qualifiers received an email this weekend with the details for the upcoming contest. If you think you qualified but didnâ€™t receive an email, please check with Ms. Razzino (mprazzino@fcps.edu).

The AIME will begin at 8:30am on Thursday, March 19 and will be in gym 2. It will finish by noon. As this is a JLC day, please make arrangements to ensure you can be there at 8:30am. This also means Gym 2 will not be open during JLC on Thursday unless you are taking the AIME. Please bring something to write with and graph paper, a ruler, a compass, and a protractor if you want.

results.title: INTERESTED IN GLOBAL HEALTH OR INTERNATIONAL DEVELOPMENT?
results.content:
TJTED will be hosting a special speaker this Friday, March 13th, during B Block in the College and Career Center! Yale Global Health Professor, Richard Skolnik, will be focusing his talk on the root causes of sickness, disability, and mortality, how this happens, and what we can do to address these issues effectively. This is a talk for everyone, whether you're looking to have a deeper understanding of public health, or would like a proper introduction/foundation.Â

Sign up on Intranet now, before space fills up!Â As always, there will be time for Q&A afterward, so bring any questions you may have!

During his 25 years working with the World Bank, SkolnikÂ worked primarily on education, health, nutrition, and population in low-income countries in sub-Saharan Africa and South Asia.Â He was previously also theÂ Director of the Harvard School of Public Health PEPFAR program for AIDS treatment in Africa.Â

More info on the speaker:Â

http://publichealth.yale.edu/people/richard_skolnik-2.profile

http://r4d.org/experts/richard-skolnik
results.author: Adam Wong

results.title: Computer Lab Etiquette
results.content:
Students,

We have had some major issues in our computer labs recently and wanted to remind all of you about computer lab etiquette. Â The most important thing that you should note is that you should not unplug mice or keyboards to use with your personal laptops when in labs. Â There has been theft of computer equipment and this should not occur at a place like TJ. Â Equipment shouldnâ€™t require constantly reconnecting unplugged or moved equipment and/or replacing missing mice and keyboards. Â Below is a list of computer lab etiquette that if followed will save our Tech Team hundreds of hours spent each school year that they spend replacing, repairing, and cleaning up after student messes. Â They could be spending this time updating computers and providing new innovative technology to students, but sadly much of it is spent doing lab maintenance and clean up. Â Thanks for your attention to this.

Computer Lab Etiquette:

  • Do not unplug computer equipment.Â If you accidentally unplug something, please plug it back in.
  • Do not remove the mouse or keyboard from the computer.
  • Do not leave trash behind.
  • No eating or drinking.
  • Report any computer problems to the teacher.
results.author: Scott Campbell

results.title: Say Nooooooooooo to scalping
results.content: TJ students should not be reselling INITE tickets for a profit. Â It's not fair (and not legal). Â If they have already done so, then students deserve their money back minus the ticket price. Â If you have purchased INITE tickets from a TJ student at higher than ticket price, resolve the issue by approaching the person directly. Â If unsuccessful at obtaining resolution, report the problem to the administration.

results.title: College Partnership Program Recruitment Open House
results.content:
Attention FRESHMEN and SOPHOMORES! The College Partnership Program is hosting a Recruitment Open House during LUNCH on Friday, February 27 in Trailer 1. You can talk to current CPP members, learn about our program, pick up an application, and enjoy some SNACKS! If you are interested in taking advantage of academic counseling, college visits, great info on financial aid, strategies for writing impressive college applications, and being part of an awesome community of students â€“ this is for you.

If any of the following apply to you (and you have at least a 2.5 GPA), please consider applying!
- Are a first-generation college student
- Are part of an NCLB subgroup identified as being in the achievement gap
- Demonstrates a willingness to pursue advanced coursework
- Demonstrates leadership in school or community activities

Please see Ms. Glotfelty in Trailer 1 or email her at slglotfelty@fcps.edu for details or if you have any questions. The application is due March 20.

results.title: February 11 & 13 - TECH LAB VISITS FOR SOPHOMORES ONLY
results.content:
On Wednesday and Friday, Sophomores have the opportunity to learn about senior research opportunities by visiting the tech labs. You may attend a combination of your regularly scheduled activities and the lab visits or all lab visits. For example, you may attend an A block activity and then tech labs for E & F blocks (the equivalent of B block). Or you may attend tech lab visits C & D blocks (the equivalent of A block) and your normal B block activity. OR you may attend tech lab visits C, D E & F blocks. It is recommended that you attend 4 tech lab visits over the two days.

Remember that A block is equal to C + D blocks and B block is equal to E + F blocks

results.title: TJ's February Frenzy Volleyball Tournament!
results.content:
You've heard of TJ's own May Madness J-Day Basketball Tournament. Now, TJ SGA brings to you the most prestigious, unpredictable, exhilarating volleyball tournament to ever be recorded in history: the February Frenzy Volleyball Tournament!

All students are eligible to form teams of four to six students for a hype volleyball tournament to be held during lunches in Gym 1 from February 18th through March 6th! We strongly encourage players of all levels and grades to participate! Prizes will be awarded to the winning team(s). Seeding information and brackets will be released by February 17th!

Team registration forms, individual player permission slips, and the $10 team registration fee are due attached TOGETHER to the box in Trailer 5 by 2:20pm on Friday, February 13th! Don't wait around!

Tournament Rules, forms, and more information are available in this link. Contact SGA at sga.tjhsst@gmail.com with any questions.

results.title: U. of Toronto Biology Competition
results.content:
Interested in taking the University of Toronto National Biology Competition? The competition will take place on April 30th, 2015. To register, please fill out this form: goo.gl/xN7WAc, and pay $7 to Tarun Kamath by February 27th. You can find Tarun at 8th period Biology Olympiad meetings or during lunch in front of the Neurobiology Lab in the new wing.Â

Â Be sure to bring exact change for the payment and a registration number.Â Participation will be capped to approximately (the first) 75 participants.

Â Upon payment, you will also need to fill out a payment receipt. More info about the competition can be found at: http://www.biocomp.utoronto.ca/. Send any questions to tjhsst.biologyolympiad@gmail.com.

Â
results.author: Eighth Period Office

results.title: Sophomore Lab Visits and Planning for Applying to Senior Research Labs â€“ Class of 2017
results.content:
In addition to this weekâ€™s Curriculum Fair, next week (Feb 11 & 13) there will be Sophomore Lab Visit Sessions during which overviews of specific labs and the mentorship program will be provided. You are expected to attend at least two of these 15-minute sessions to learn about the labs and also learn about necessary prerequisite course requirements for your intended senior year research lab interests. For these, you will sign up using the 8th period sign ups BUT for combinations of C & D and/or E &F Blocks (instead of A or B). You must do combinations of C & D or E & F to visit two or four different sessions, and can do this on each Wednesday and Friday enabling you to visit in total up to eight different sessions.

Questions related to a specific lab or the mentorship program shall be addressed during these research lab visit sessions. Students are asked to take necessary prerequisite courses to be eligible for TWO research labs so you have options next year during the application process. These visits should help you focus on which labs to consider for your senior year and help you in scheduling possible prerequisites. To better understand what prerequisites are needed for respective labs, please see the summarized Prerequisites Lab sheet here.
results.author: James Woglom

results.title: USABO Open Exam Participants
results.content:
The USA Biology Olympiad Open Exam is scheduled for Wednesday, February 11, 2015 in Gym 2.

All participants previously signed up for this restricted activity must be settled and ready to start by the beginning of A block. As soon as you arrive, take a seat facing forward and stay seated.

To have your exam graded by the CEE, you MUST do the following:

Â Use #2 pencils; Bring several sharpened, with good erasers.

Â Complete a Student Certificate which will be provided.

Â Complete ALL personal information on your scantron.

Â Provide the proper CEE ID (NOT FCPS SID) on your scantron.

o Note that you will need to BRING your CEE ID; it will not be provided for you.

Â Never use an electronic device.

Â Do not leave your seat once the examination process has begun, until the time you are dismissed, even if you finish early.

Â Follow instructions given on exam day, and

Â Turn in all your paperwork AS DIRECTED.

Bring a watch if you are concerned about time management.

No additional time will be given for erasing, bubbling in, writing your name, etc. When the exam time runs out, you will be asked to turn in your paperwork immediately. Follow the instructions!

Reminder: The exam will occur during both A and B blocks.

results.title: NVADACA Scholarship for Senior Athletes
results.content:
Senior Athletes â€“ NVADACA Scholarship: The Northern Virginia Athletic Directors, Administrators and Coaches Association is again offering 15 scholarships of $3,000 each to graduating senior athletes in Virginia. Seniors who have served on a Virginia High School League sanctioned sports team, cheerleaders, team managers or athletic trainers are eligible to apply. Three of the 15 scholarships will be awarded to applicants who are physically challenged, planning a career in Elementary Education, or are 2-year letter winners in High School baseball or softball. TJ may nominate 6 students.

Interested students please submit your name to Mrs. Kropf by February 6. All interested students will be reviewed for eligibility and the final 6 candidates will be asked to submit an application by the NVADACA deadline.
results.author: James Woglom

results.title: Last Call--It's time to clear your 8th period absences!
results.content:
The list for 8th period detention is being created this week! PLEASE CLEAR YOUR ABSENCES. To be removed you must clear your 8th period absences BEFORE 4pm on Friday, February 13 . Many from January may still be cleared. How?

It's simple: click on the absence link from your home page, print the page and ask the teacher to sign off that you were there -- be sure to include your name, your ID, the name of the activity that you attended. Return the sheet to room 231 and you're done!

To keep from getting an absence:

  • Go to the activity that you chose -- and don't leave!
  • Make sure your teacher knows you are there.
  • DO NOT sign the bottom of a roster or attendance sheet. These names are not included in attendance and will result in an absence.
  • Don't ask a substitute to 'call you in', they can't! Absences in activities with a substitute teacher cannot be cleared!
  • Turn in your pass to the sponsor as soon as you arrive!
  • QUESTIONS? See Mrs. Burch or Mrs. Lauducci in the 8th period office (room 231)
results.author: Eighth Period Office
